LanguageData.Actor72.description: {PAWN_nameDef} {PAWN_gender ? мандрував : мандрувала} в компанії акторів, які виступали в переповнених театрах та всюди мали люблячу аудиторію. {PAWN_pronoun} {PAWN_gender ? був : була} {PAWN_gender ? перфекціоністом : перфекціоністкою}, тому {PAWN_gender ? робив : робила} власні костюми та декорації, замість того, щоб використовувати ті, що йому давали.
LanguageData.Actor72.title: актор
LanguageData.AnimalFarmer21.description: {PAWN_nameDef} {PAWN_gender ? розводив : розводила} різноманітних тварин, щоб забезпечити себе м'ясом, молоком, яйцями та шкірою.
LanguageData.AnimalFarmer21.title: тваринник
LanguageData.AsceticPriest84.description: Давши обітницю мовчання, {PAWN_nameDef} {PAWN_gender ? приєднався : приєдналася} до монастиря, щоб провести свої дні у тихому роздумі.\n\n{PAWN_pronoun} {PAWN_gender ? знайшов : знайшла} щастя у вирощувані овочів у саду та виготовленні сиру у монастирських підвалах.
LanguageData.AsceticPriest84.title: аскетичний монах
LanguageData.Bartender62.description: {PAWN_nameDef} {PAWN_gender ? працював : працювала} {PAWN_gender ? барменом : барменкою} у занедбаному закладі. {PAWN_possessive} робота складалась зі змішування напоїв, дипломатії та мордобою.
LanguageData.Bartender62.title: бармен
LanguageData.Bodyguard58.description: {PAWN_nameDef} {PAWN_gender ? захищав : захищала} будь-кого, хто {PAWN_objective} заплатить. {PAWN_pronoun} {PAWN_gender ? набув : набула} майстерності у багатьох видах бойових мистецтв, та {PAWN_gender ? був відомим : була відомою} за {PAWN_possessive} безжальність до тих, хто став у {PAWN_gender ? нього : неї} на шляху.
LanguageData.Bodyguard58.title: охоронець
LanguageData.CaveExplorer45.description: {PAWN_nameDef} {PAWN_gender ? заробляв : заробляла} на життя, складаючи карти темних тунелів і майже недоступних ущелин у пошуках цінних корисних копалин. Робота {PAWN_possessive} була дуже небезпечною, але добре оплачувалася.
LanguageData.CaveExplorer45.title: дослідник печер
LanguageData.Chef52.title: шеф-кухар
LanguageData.CivilServant2.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a low-ranking administrator for a moribund government bureaucracy. [PAWN_pronoun] is most at home filling out complicated paperwork and playing office politics.
LanguageData.CivilServant2.title: держслужбовець
LanguageData.ConArtist80.description: [PAWN_nameDef] never created anything in [PAWN_possessive] life. [PAWN_pronoun] did, however, prove to be a natural at getting others to give [PAWN_objective] what they had created.
LanguageData.ConArtist80.title: шахрай
LanguageData.ConceptualArtist39.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was well-known in art circles on [PAWN_possessive] home world for [PAWN_possessive] unique and creative conceptual artworks.\n\nNobody was sure exactly what [PAWN_pronoun] was trying to communicate, but [PAWN_possessive] pieces were highly valued by collectors.
LanguageData.ConceptualArtist39.title: художник-концептуаліст
LanguageData.ConstructionEngineer32.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a construction worker. [PAWN_pronoun] lead a team which built everything from office blocks to cathedrals.\n\n[PAWN_possessive] busy job and numerous nearby fast-food outlets meant [PAWN_pronoun] never cooked for [PAWN_objective]self.
LanguageData.ConstructionEngineer32.title: інженер-будівельник
LanguageData.ContractMiner86.description: [PAWN_nameDef] moved from job to job, extracting minerals and ancient valuables in tunnels and strip-mines. The work was tough and dirty, but [PAWN_pronoun] found it rewarding.
LanguageData.ContractMiner86.title: найманий шахтар
LanguageData.CorporateManager76.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked in a massive open-plan office, ensuring that [PAWN_possessive] assigned team of workers stayed mostly on-task.\n\nThe job was intensely political. In order to advance, [PAWN_nameDef] learned how to arrange things so [PAWN_pronoun] could take credit for work done by almost anyone.
LanguageData.CorporateManager76.title: менеджер корпорації
LanguageData.Counselor26.description: A terrifying trauma when [PAWN_nameDef] was a young adult caused [PAWN_objective] to develop a serious eating disorder. With counseling [PAWN_pronoun] learned to have a healthier relationship with food, and decided to put [PAWN_possessive] new skills to use helping others overcome their emotional problems.
LanguageData.Counselor26.title: психотерапевт
LanguageData.CropFarmer17.description: [PAWN_nameDef] ran a crop farm. [PAWN_pronoun] analyzed soil, agricultural equipment, weather patterns, and price trends to optimize the planting and harvesting of massive crop fields.
LanguageData.CropFarmer17.title: землероб
LanguageData.Defector78.description: Early in [PAWN_possessive] adulthood, [PAWN_nameDef] decided to leave the oppressive dictatorship where [PAWN_pronoun] lived. [PAWN_possessive] defection was not well-received, and agents were sent out after [PAWN_objective].\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] spent years on the run, treating [PAWN_possessive] own wounds so no doctor could betray [PAWN_objective]. The ordeal made [PAWN_objective] bitter and untrusting.
LanguageData.Defector78.title: перебіжчик
LanguageData.Drifter67.description: [PAWN_nameDef] never figured out what to do with [PAWN_possessive] life. [PAWN_pronoun] traveled often, taking up casual work wherever [PAWN_pronoun] found it.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] also occasionally worked on a novel that [PAWN_pronoun] knew would be a bestseller - just as soon as [PAWN_pronoun] could find a publisher who was interested.
LanguageData.Drifter67.title: мандрівник
LanguageData.EscapedConvict90.description: [PAWN_nameDef] denies involvement in the crimes that brought about [PAWN_possessive] incarceration in a brutal penal colony. [PAWN_pronoun] escaped by tunneling beneath the perimeter using modified cutlery.
LanguageData.EscapedConvict90.title: біглий в'язень
LanguageData.Evangelist39.description: У молодості, {PAWN_nameDef} релігійно {PAWN_gender? пробудився: пробудилася}. {PAWN_pronoun} {PAWN_gender? вирішив: вирішила} провести своє життя розносячи слово про своє божество, красу цієї культури та альтернативну медицину.
LanguageData.Evangelist39.title: проповідник
LanguageData.ExplosivesExpert26.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was an explosive engineer employed in mines. [PAWN_pronoun] took [PAWN_possessive] job very seriously and was well-versed in the technicalities - so much so that [PAWN_pronoun] refused to demean [PAWN_objective]self by helping with the clean-up once [PAWN_possessive] carefully-calculated explosion was complete.
LanguageData.ExplosivesExpert26.title: експерт з вибухівки
LanguageData.Forester96.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew and harvested forests. [PAWN_pronoun] understood both the practical challenges of soil types, wind, and rain, as well as the long-term planning of forest growth.
LanguageData.Forester96.title: лісник
LanguageData.FurnitureBuilder83.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up near forests. [PAWN_pronoun] spent [PAWN_possessive] time building beautiful furniture for wealthy glitterworld clients.
LanguageData.FurnitureBuilder83.title: збиральник меблів
LanguageData.Gardener99.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked at the mansion of a powerful family, tending the lavish gardens as part of a team of servants.
LanguageData.Gardener99.title: садівник
LanguageData.Geologist66.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked with miners and cave-diggers, identifying rock types and natural formations.\n\nDuring [PAWN_possessive] years underground [PAWN_pronoun] also gained experience repairing drilling machines and other technical equipment.
LanguageData.Geologist66.title: геолог
LanguageData.Housemate8.description: As an adult, [PAWN_nameDef] kept house and cared for [PAWN_possessive] children while [PAWN_possessive] spouse worked.
LanguageData.Housemate8.title: домогосподар
LanguageData.HouseServant63.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a domestic servant to wealthy homeowners.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] got to know the kitchens and basements of [PAWN_possessive] master's mansion well, but never did any work outside.
LanguageData.HouseServant63.title: домашня прислуга
LanguageData.Hunter89.description: [PAWN_nameDef] hunted wild animals to help feed [PAWN_possessive] community. When times became tough, others looked to [PAWN_objective] as the one to help people through a tough season.
LanguageData.Hunter89.title: мисливець
LanguageData.Inventor6.description: On [PAWN_possessive] homeworld, [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a moderately successful inventor. [PAWN_pronoun] developed several minor technologies.
LanguageData.Inventor6.title: винахідник
LanguageData.Jailbird40.description: [PAWN_nameDef] spent most of [PAWN_possessive] life in prisons, where [PAWN_pronoun] was put to work in the kitchens. [PAWN_pronoun] had a habit of getting into fights, and developed an aggressive way of speaking.
LanguageData.Jailbird40.title: арештант
LanguageData.LivestockFarmer8.description: [PAWN_nameDef] ran a livestock farm. [PAWN_pronoun] analyzed animal genetics, feed types, birth and slaughter methods, and price trends to optimize the raising of huge animal herds.
LanguageData.LivestockFarmer8.title: скотар
LanguageData.Logger95.description: [PAWN_nameDef] took down trees and collected wood in hilly passes and ravines. [PAWN_pronoun] learned both how to fell the trees safely, and how to manage the forest to keep it healthy.
LanguageData.Logger95.title: лісоруб
LanguageData.LowWageWorker7.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked a variety of casual jobs to support [PAWN_possessive] family, gaining a set of basic hands-on skills.
LanguageData.LowWageWorker7.title: малооплачуваний робітник
LanguageData.MachineCollector55.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was obsessed with old machines and arcane pieces of technology. [PAWN_pronoun] obtained them wherever [PAWN_pronoun] could, and loved taking them apart to see how they worked.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] had a habit of talking about [PAWN_possessive] collection long after people around [PAWN_objective] had stopped listening.
LanguageData.MachineCollector55.title: колекціонер машин
LanguageData.Mathematician6.description: [PAWN_nameDef] did mathematical research at a university.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] spent much of [PAWN_possessive] spare time immersed in shooting simulations, though [PAWN_pronoun] was frequently ridiculed by other players for [PAWN_possessive] terrible aim.
LanguageData.Mathematician6.title: професор математики
LanguageData.Model99.description: [PAWN_nameDef] modelled clothes and jewellery for advertisers, and was also used as a physical blueprint for characters in virtual reality simulations.
LanguageData.Model99.title: модель
LanguageData.Nurse61.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked in a hospital, doing routine work such as changing bandages and taking temperatures.\n\nIt was a busy job, but [PAWN_pronoun] could always find time for a chat with a patient.
LanguageData.Nurse61.title: медбрат
LanguageData.Paramedic45.description: [PAWN_nameDef]'s job was to respond rapidly to medical emergencies. [PAWN_pronoun] is used to dealing with severe injuries with only limited medical supplies.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] treated so many gunshot wounds over the years that even seeing a gun made [PAWN_objective] uncomfortable.
LanguageData.Paramedic45.title: парамедик
LanguageData.Policeman45.description: [PAWN_nameDef] kept the peace as a line officer in a municipal social enforcement unit.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] was trained in de-escalation, physical control, shooting, and other police skills.
LanguageData.Policeman45.title: офіцер поліції
LanguageData.QuarryWorker29.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked in a quarry helping to extract valuable stone from the hillside. [PAWN_pronoun] learned to sense opportunities and dangers in the stone by sight, touch, and intuition.
LanguageData.QuarryWorker29.title: робітник каменоломні
LanguageData.Rancher43.description: [PAWN_nameDef] owned and operated a successful ranch where [PAWN_pronoun] raised animals for meat and wool.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] refused to do any dumb labour [PAWN_pronoun] could pay someone else to do for [PAWN_objective].
LanguageData.Rancher43.title: хазяїн ранчо
LanguageData.Ranger96.description: [PAWN_nameDef] tracked animals and people for a wide range of clients. [PAWN_pronoun] became adept at reading spoor, finding food in the wild, and stalking prey.
LanguageData.Ranger96.title: рейнджер
LanguageData.Recruiter14.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was part of a revered order of martial artists, infamous both for their skill in combat and for their practice of refusing to treat their wounded.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] traveled [PAWN_possessive] homeworld, judging the young people [PAWN_pronoun] met to determine if they might be suitable for training.
LanguageData.Recruiter14.title: рекрутер
LanguageData.Slaughterer58.description: {PAWN_nameDef} {PAWN_gender ? заробляв : заробляла} на життя забоєм тварин. Інші вважали цю роботу брудною, але навички для забою великої кількості тварин ніколи не були простими.
LanguageData.Slaughterer58.title: забійник
LanguageData.Teacher20.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was educated in the liberal arts and taught at a public school. [PAWN_pronoun] was widely knowledgeable and well-liked by [PAWN_possessive] students.
LanguageData.Teacher20.title: вчитель
LanguageData.Torturer37.description: Working for a tyrannical dictator, [PAWN_nameDef] earned a reputation as an expert in 'persuasion.' Any prisoner who went down into the dungeons left with no secrets - and with [PAWN_nameDef]'s smile scarred permanently into their nightmares.
LanguageData.Torturer37.title: мучитель
LanguageData.Veterinarian99.description: [PAWN_nameDef] treated sick and injured animals for a living. Seeing their suffering affected [PAWN_possessive] stance on the practice of eating meat, and for many years [PAWN_pronoun] lived as a vegetarian.
LanguageData.Veterinarian99.title: ветеринар
